Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk openssh
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: openssh bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated openssh packages that fix two bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. OpenSSH is an SSH protocol implementation supported by a number of Linux, UNIX, and similar operating systems. It includes the core files necessary for both the OpenSSH client and server.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* In Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.3, the chroot setup in OpenSSH did not work properly. Secondary groups of users in chroot were not correctly initialized, and capabilities were trimmed for these users. The chroot setup was fixed to match earlier behavior, and groups and capabilities of users set up using OpenSSH chroot now work as expected. (BZ#1399640)
* Previously, a race condition in an Audit-related part of the OpenSSH code was not fixed properly. As a consequence, OpenSSH clients were unable to connect to servers with large Message of the Day (MOTD). The Audit-related part of the code is now executed before sending the MOTD, and the client connections work even if the server sends a very large message. (BZ#1406396)
Users of OpenSSH are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
